text.sentence: Yesterday, ADI hosted its analyst day in NYC to give an update on the company's positioning for the future and target financial model, as well as some further details on its recent acquisition of Hittite .
ADI is largely through its shift away from consumer products and is targeting growth at two threex GDP, driving towards a long range target of dollar four five of EPS by two thousand twenty.

We recognize ADI's core business has strong and defensible positioning in the certain areas of high performance analog, which the HITT acquisition significantly bolsters, but remain on the sidelines waiting for better indications that this will translate into outsized growth vs. its peers and/or a better entry point given the higher valuation for analog names.
HP RF, Auto, Industrial, and Comm Infra to Drive Growth: Management emphasized its focus on Auto, Industrial, and Comm, while remaining selective in Consumer.

HP RF is expected to grow to a SAM of dollar threeB, while Comm Infra is expected to reach a dollar fourB SAM, and factory automation is set to hit dollar fiveB SAM by two thousand twenty ­ all netting growth at two threex GDP.
Further HITT Acquisition Details: ADI provided further details on its recently announced acquisition of Hittite, notably the strategic rationale, tax structure, and financial impact .
The figures presented do not include revenue synergies, which we believe could drive further upside.

Updated Target Financial Model: Management provided an update to its target financial model, with expectations to grow organic revenue at two threex GDP, achieve GMs of sixty five sixty eight percent, OPMs of thirty two thirty six percent, and EPS growth of eight fifteen percent .

In addition, ADI is targeting CF from ops of thirty two thirty six percent and FCF of twenty eight thirty two percent of revenue, and is committed to returning eighty percent of FCF to shareholders via a mix of dividends growing at five ten percent, and opportunistic buybacks.

We acknowledge ADI pays a nice dividend and is levered to very stable end markets, but from a stock perspective we see little upside from here with the shares trading at twentyx our CYfifteen estimates without a more aggressive capital return program.

Our upside case of dollar fifty five is based on twentyx our upside CYfifteen EPS of dollar two.eighty which assumes above industry growth and solid operating margin expansion to ~thirty five percent .

Our downside case of dollar forty is based on seventeenx our downside CYthirteen EPS of dollar two.thirty five which assumes slower growth and limited margin improvement ; offset by implied dividend yield of ~three.five

High performance RF signal processing remains a major focus for ADI, particularly with its acquisition of HITT which expands its product portfolio across the RF spectrum to include the growing higher frequency market.
The trend toward higher frequencies has evolved over time and is mainly driven by crowded spectrum at the lower frequency end as well as a need for better accuracy and smaller form factors .
ADI is well positioned as its strong offering at the lower frequencies is complemented by HITT's higher frequency products ­ a major driver of the acquisition.

In addition, in regards to the acquisition, customer response has been positive as both companies serve similar customers/end markets and now the combined company offers a more complete solution for signal processing.

The Automotive segment, which is just under twenty percent of revenue, is expected to be a major driver of ADI growth over the coming years due to the electrification of the automobile ­ with six eightK semis in each Audi vehicle and over twenty twoB sensors per year in Auto by two thousand twenty.

Safety, fuel efficiency, and emissions reductions are the three major drivers of the auto revolution, highlighted by the stat that fifty percent of the latest Euro vehicles come equipped with fuelefficient start/stop technology .

Going forward, autonomous driving ­ made possible by installing sensors in each car, enabling car to car and car to infrastructure communications ­ should significantly contribute to the increased semi content in autos and also potentially improve safety on the roads.
The Industrial segment is set to continue to grow to a SAM of dollar fiveB by two thousand twenty with a focus on factory automation.
Management laid out four major growth drivers for Industrial: one.)
The connected enterprise primarily deals with replacing the aging manufacturing equipment and systems with machines equipped with sensors allowing for

Communications test and measurement refers to the testing of each device connection to the Internet, while infrastructure reinvestment focuses on equipping the existing infrastructure with sensors to detect potential issues.
Finally, the energy ecosystem is focused on the technology enabling clean water and clean air, as well as the sophisticated tech that can endure high temperatures .
In terms of drivers by geography, Europe along with Japan continues to drive industrial automation, while N. America and China have contributed to a lesser extent.

Comm Infrastructure, which makes up twenty percent of sales, is expected to grow to a SAM of dollar fourB by two thousand twenty, driven by an increasing amount of connected devices with increasing data demands .

Management estimates <twenty percent of LTE adoption worldwide with sixty percent of users in Korea, single digits percent in China, Europe trying to catch up, the US with coverage but needing capacity, and most others <twenty percent .
So far, the TD LTE ramp has been the equivalent of the last two years of TD SCDMA, while FDD has just been announced and the rollout of threeG is still far from over .
Network operators continue to spend billions on spectrum, and electricity composes one/three of operating expense .
Overall, the trends in the industry bode well for players like ADI who provide components enhancing the flexibility, efficiency, and coverage of the increasingly stressed network.
ADI provided further details on its recently announced acquisition of HITT including strategic rationale as well as the potential financial impact.
From a strategic perspective, the acquisition makes sense in allowing ADI immediate access to higher spectrum HP RF products versus the timely process of organic internal development.
In addition, the combined company can now serve as a more complete supplier of HP RF products across the spectrum and leverage ADI's more robust sales channel.

Management also noted that in this environment it is increasingly more challenging for smaller companies to compete beyond the position they have today ­ thus M and A seems to make a lot of sense in providing broader access to customers to scale operations and enhance product platfor Miss From a financial perspective, ADI plans to fund the acquisition with dollar twoB in debt and dollar five hundredM in cash from HITT's balance sheet.

The acquisition should first hit in Qfour and is expected to be immediately accretive to OPM, GM, and EPS, with high single digit accretion growth in two thousand fifteen, and mid teens accretion growth by two thousand sixteen ­ driven by operational efficiencies as well as tax benefits .
No revenue synergies are baked in, however, we expect a portion should be realized as HITT is further integrated in two thousand fifteen.
ADI plans to release the tender offer sometime over the next few days, and plans to close the transaction by the end of Qthree.

Management provided an update to its target financial model, with expectations to grow organic revenue at two threex GDP, achieve GMs of sixty five sixty eight percent, OPMs of thirty two thirty six percent, and EPS growth of eight fifteen percent .

In addition, ADI is targeting CF from ops of thirty two thirty six percent of revenue, FCF of twenty eight thirty two percent of revenue, and is committed to returning eighty percent of FCF to shareholders via a mix of dividends growing at five ten percent, and opportunistic buybacks.
Net, net the Company expects dollar four five of EPS by two thousand twenty ­ which seems to be more of an indicator of business expectations than an actual target.

In terms of investments, ADI plans to continue to spend dollar five hundredM per year on R and D, with a further emphasis on higher margin segments including HP signal processing, Industrial, and Infrastructure.
Capacity wise, ADI is currently running at roughly mid seventy percent utilization, has
Barclays | Analog Devices plenty of clean room to expand with limited need for additional capex, and continues to keep front end wafer manufacturing split fifty/fifty between internal and external.

Translated to financial terms, for every one percent improvement in utilization, expect a roughly tenbp lift in GM ­ eighty percent fall through on incremental revenue, with increased leverage if utilizing internal facilities.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Corporate and Investment Banking Division of Barclays is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Valuation Methodology: Our price target of dollar forty nine is nineteenx our CYfifteen EPS estimate of dollar two.sixty three Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: We believe our forecasts and price target could be at risk for the following reasons: demand for semiconductors slows down; pricing becomes more aggressive and destabilizes; and the company loses share to its competitors.
